data.title: Pranjal Chalise felicitated as WaiWai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021
data.snippet:
Kathmandu); and Sabhya Rai, (19 year old education activist from IIam) Chalise has aided the blind community by inventing Drishti Nepal which helps in recognising currency bills and cash transactions. He has also developed a mobile application that provides agricultural news and information from authentic sources. Another app is a women safety app. And two other educational apps have 7,500 users. Chalise has also initiated a non-profit tech venture called E-educators Nepal which enhances the quality of online education and makes educational resources more accessible. He is currently working on a research paper about blockchain technology and smart contracts and the ways in which technological advancement can mitigate the costs of elongated transaction processes.  About Us
 Our Team [...] Pranjal Chalise, a 19-year-old technopreneur from Kathmandu, was awarded the title of ‚ÄòWaiWai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021‚Äô at a virtual award ceremony organised by Glocal on September 1. It is the seventh iteration of the Glocal Teen Hero Award, which is the only national platform in Nepal to identify and honour outstanding teenagers whose creativity, commitment, experience, and strong leadership have helped them achieve success in life. Chalise was selected among the top six finalists: Anurag Chapagain, (18 years old YouTuber from Nawalparasi); Deepak Sutihar (19 year old social entrepreneur from Saptari); Khusbu Bhandari, (18 year old wildlife conservationist from Chitwan); Neha Gurung, (19 year old social activist from Kathmandu); and Sabhya Rai, (19 year old education activist

data.title: Team Tumornators | An Incubate Nepal Project
data.snippet:
2021

## Pranjal Chalise

Team Kisan, Team Drishti(2020)

‚ÄúA surreal utopia where friends turned into F.R.I.E.N.D.S, and fanatics into professionals. Contributing to two different teams- ‚ÄòTeam Kisan' and ‚ÄòTeam Drishti' was overwhelming but the realization that, through my projects, I could deliver ripple effects in the community- be it in the lives of farmers or differently-abled people, was certainly more promising. A bunch of high-school pass-outs coming together to create impacts on society sounds a bit fancy. At Incubate Nepal you'll witness countless such fancy sugarcoats turning into real-life realities.‚Äù

2020

## Anupa Khanal

Team Brahmanda(2020) [...] 2021

## Aayusha Dhungana

Team Samsad(2021)

‚ÄúPolitics and Social science, something that I was not really fond of. But to my own surprise, I was paired up with my team mates to build a website featuring parliament system of Nepal. Entering the whole new world of website building and politics surely frightened me, but the continuous support from the mentor and my wonderful team made this whole journey very smooth and informative. Incubate Nepal, helped me break my comforting cocoon and stand out in the crowd to learn, take challenges and share tons of memories with the whole team.‚Äù

2021

## Pranjal Chalise

Team Kisan, Team Drishti(2020) [...] 2020

## Aarasi Shrestha

Team Arthasastra(2020)

‚ÄúIncubate Nepal provided students like me with a platform to share our knowledge on a wide range of topics, hone our leadership skills and team spirit, and it acted as a stepping stone towards accomplishing our future goals and ambitions. Being a team member of ‚ÄòTeam Arthasastra,' my teammates and I prepared an empirical Economics research paper. Last-minute virtual meetings to complete the tasks that we were assigned, late nights of watching YouTube videos and reading articles on econometrics, and listening to the amazing weekly presentations from different groups helped me in more ways than I thought it would.‚Äù

2020

## Mahesh Yadav

Team Brahmanda(2020)

Muhammad Rizwan [...] and Calendar all live inside AI. You speak. ‚Üí It acts. ‚Üí Instantly. The old Android vs iOS debate? ‚Üí Over. The new race is Apple vs Google vs OpenAI ‚Äî ‚Üí A race to own your intelligence layer. And if that‚Äôs true... ‚Üí Then the question isn‚Äôt ‚ÄúWhich phone is better?‚Äù anymore. ‚Üí It‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhich intelligence will run your life?‚Äù Because by 2030, your phone won‚Äôt have an OS ‚Äî ‚Üí It‚Äôll have a personality ü§ç I‚Äôm genuinely curious ‚Äî ‚Üí Do you think we‚Äôre ready to live in a world where AI replaces the very idea of an operating system? #PostOSEra #AIRevolution #OpenAI #AppleIntelligence #GeminiAI #FutureTech #DigitalShift #Innovation #CtrlAltDiva #AI #AIEngineer #DeepLearning #MachineLearning #CNN #Google [...] 2030: Your Phone No Longer Has an OS ‚Äî It Has a Brain. ‚Üí Sometimes, I wonder if we‚Äôre already witnessing the quiet death of the Operating System. ‚Üí Because look around ‚Äî AI is slowly becoming the system itself. You wake up. ‚Üí Your AI has already booked your ride, written your emails, and adjusted your playlist to match your mood. No apps. No icons. No OS updates. ‚Üí Just Intelligence. üí° Apple‚Äôs Siri no longer just assists ‚Äî it thinks, powered by Apple Intelligence and, when needed, OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT. üí° Gemini isn‚Äôt just Android‚Äôs sidekick anymore ‚Äî it‚Äôs the brain for billions of devices, quietly learning your tone, patterns, even your emotion. üí° And the ChatGPT Platform? ‚Üí It‚Äôs no longer a chatbot ‚Äî it‚Äôs where your Spotify, Canva, and Calendar all live inside AI. You speak. ‚Üí It acts. ‚Üí
